dt: {bc}to show displeasure by thrusting out the lips or wearing a sullen expression

dt.t: Sure, you have sports figures misbehaving today. John McEnroe {wi}pouts{/wi} and snarls and curses at tennis judges twice his age, on television …

dt: {bc}to push out or purse the lips in a sexually suggestive way

dt.t: … appears in adverts surrounded by gorgeous, {wi}pouting{/wi} blondes.
If they invited her out, she declined the invitation. When they went out, she would be {wi}pouting{/wi} when they came home.

shortdef: to show displeasure by thrusting out the lips or wearing a sullen expression
to push out or purse the lips in a sexually suggestive way

dt: {bc}a protrusion of the lips expressive of displeasure

shortdef: a protrusion of the lips expressive of displeasure

dt: {bc}any of several large-headed fishes (such as a bullhead or eelpout)

et: probably from Middle English {it}*poute{/it}, a fish with a large head, from Old English {it}-pūte{/it}; akin to Middle English {it}pouten{/it} to pout
shortdef: any of several large-headed fishes (such as a bullhead or eelpout)

dt: {bc}a common mottled olive to brown bullhead ({it}A. nebulosus{/it} synonym {it}Ictalurus nebulosus{/it}) of eastern North America that has been introduced into western streams

shortdef: a bullhead (genus Ameiurus); especially : a common mottled olive to brown bullhead (A. nebulosus synonym Ictalurus nebulosus) of eastern North America that has been introduced into western streams
